title: CKiD U25 eGFR Calculator
description: Estimates glomerular filtration rate based on creatinine and/or cystatin C in patients aged 1 to 25 years

parameters.name: equation_type
parameters.description: Type of equation to use for eGFR calculation

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: Patient height in centimeters (required for creatinine-based equations)

parameters.name: serum_creatinine
parameters.description: Serum creatinine level in mg/dL (required for creatinine-based equations)

parameters.name: cystatin_c
parameters.description: Cystatin C level in mg/L (required for cystatin C-based equations)

ranges.interpretation: Normal kidney function with kidney damage
Mild to moderate reduction in kidney function
Moderate to severe reduction in kidney function
Kidney failure requiring dialysis or transplantation

references: Pierce CB, Muñoz A, Ng DK, Warady BA, Furth SL, Schwartz GJ. Age- and sex-dependent clinical equations to estimate glomerular filtration rates in children and young adults with chronic kidney disease. Kidney Int. 2021 Oct;100(4):948-959.
Schwartz GJ, Muñoz A, Schneider MF, Mak RH, Kaskel F, Warady BA, et al. New equations to estimate GFR in children with CKD. J Am Soc Nephrol. 2009 Mar;20(3):629-37.
Levey AS, Stevens LA, Schmid CH, Zhang YL, Castro AF 3rd, Feldman HI, et al. A new equation to estimate glomerular filtration rate. Ann Intern Med. 2009 May 5;150(9):604-12.
formula: Age- and sex-dependent equations: k × (height/sCr) for creatinine-based or k × (1/cysC) for cystatin C-based calculations
notes: Superior to other pediatric equations for ages 1-25 years
Eliminates 'jumps' in eGFR when transitioning from pediatric to adult equations
Can use creatinine alone, cystatin C alone, or both for improved accuracy
For patients 18-25 years, consider comparing with adult CKD-EPI equations
